hook: The most significant statistical mismatch of Super Bowl 60 isn't at quarterback or head coach, but in the 20 yards of real estate where championships are actually decided.

sections.title: The Four-Point Swing
key_points: Define the massive efficiency gap between the two teams.
Explain the mathematical impact of settling for field goals vs touchdowns.
Contextualize this as a systemic advantage rather than statistical noise.
stats_facts: 49ers convert 68.4% of RZ trips to TDs (1st in NFC).
This 16% delta represents a +3.4 EPA advantage per game.
sections.transition: This statistical gap is massive on paper, but the unique geometry of Levi's Stadium makes it even more critical.

sections.title: The Geometry of the North End Zone
key_points: Discuss the architectural quirk of Levi's Stadium's North End Zone.
Explain how compressed fields hurt spread offenses.
Analyze why this favors power run schemes over vertical passing.
stats_facts: North End Zone is 8 yards deep vs standard 10 yards.
Vertical routes are compressed by 20%, limiting fade routes.
Opponent's defensive speed is neutralized in tight quarters.
sections.transition: When the field shrinks, personnel packages dictate success, and the 49ers have a specific weapon for this compressed space.

sections.title: The 21 Personnel Cheat Code
key_points: Highlight the 49ers' heavy usage of 2 RB sets (21 personnel).
Explain how this forces the defense into heavy base packages.
Detail the mismatch against the opponent's run defense.
stats_facts: 49ers use 21 personnel on 42% of red zone snaps (League High).
Opponent allows 5.2 yards per carry inside the 20 (30th in league).
Success rate of run vs pass inside the 10-yard line favors SF heavily.
sections.transition: While the 49ers are built to punch it in, the opponent's reliance on a 'Bend Don't Break' philosophy is a liability in this matchup.

sections.title: The 'Bend Don't Break' Fallacy
key_points: Address the counter-argument that the opponent's defense tightens up.
Explain why 'bending' against SF leads to 7 points, not 3.
Contrast the volatility of RZ stats vs the consistency of SF's scheme.
stats_facts: 49ers have maintained >65% RZ efficiency for three consecutive seasons.
Opponent Red Zone Defense DVOA drops significantly vs Top 10 offenses.
Quote: 'In a game projected to be a shootout, settling for 3 is a turnover.'
sections.transition: Understanding this efficiency gap reveals specific value in the betting markets that the public is overlooking.

sections.title: Pricing the Disparity
key_points: Identify where the market has missed this angle.
Provide specific betting recommendations based on the data.
Deliver the final verdict on the game script.
stats_facts: Target 'Over 2.5 Field Goals' for the opponent due to stall rate.
Target 'Anytime TD' for 49ers RBs/Fullbacks given the usage rates.
sections.transition: The market sees two elite teams, but the red zone math sees a blowout in efficiency.
